history.content:
From what I've seen it seems like class size is generally smaller in the fall. I guess because it's more common for people do 61A in fall and then 61B in spring?  According to the courses page, last fall the class size was 732 so it looks like they've already expanded the class more than usual for fall semester...  

I also want to declare data science, but I'm a bit higher on the waitlist as well, so hopefully they expand it more to accommodate for all the data science people (especially those who don't meet the reserved seating requirement ), but when I scroll down the Piazza history, it doesn't seem like posts regarding this issue are being addressed so far .. :(

I'm not CS, intended CS or EECS so maybe someone knows more about this?

-Another thing I noticed is that when the class was expanded by about 50 seats a few days ago, I only moved down the waitlist by about 20 seats.  I'm confused because I assumed that this was just because priority was given to CS majors, but the pinned Piazza post said that students major is not taken into consideration when processing the waitlist :/

From what I've seen it seems like class size is generally smaller in the fall. I guess because it's more common for people do 61A in fall and then 61B in spring?  According to the courses page, last fall the class size was 732 so it looks like they've already expanded the class more than usual for fall semester...  

I also want to declare data science, but I'm a bit higher on the waitlist as well, so hopefully they expand it more to accommodate for all the data science people (especially those who don't meet the reserved seating requirement ), but when I scroll down the Piazza history, it doesn't seem like posts regarding this issue are being addressed so far .. :(

I'm not CS, intended CS or EECS so maybe someone knows more about this?

children.subject: +1. I would also not go over my enrollment caps, but I'm wondering if there is some error in CalCentral where units from dropped classes are counted? At one point I had dropped another class, but it still shows up as 'dropped' when I go to add a new class; is it possible these extra 'dropped' units are causing the system to think I have over 20.5 units? I wasn't bypassed, but my number didn't move by exactly 105 seats.

That might be it, I dropped a class earlier in adjustment as well. However, normally if you are bypassed when seats open up CalCentral sends an email along the lines of "you were unable to be enrolled in the course XXX because you have reached the term limit..." I didn't get an email like that but clearly was not able to enroll for some reason. Could be a bug with the dropped classes that doesn't trigger the email notification, could be something else...

Really confused about the expansions and waitlist processing. The class expanded by 105 seats last nigjt but I'm still waitlisted. Enrolling would not hit any unit caps for me and I didn't receive an email from CalCentral with any reason I couldn't be added the class. Could someone address this?

history.content: We're well into the adjustment period and I'm 77 on the CS61B waitlist-- is there any chance I'll still get in!? I thought the waitlist would clear since the class size was >1300 last semester but now it looks closed at just 795. I'm a junior, need this class to declare Data Science next semester, and pretty much cleared the rest of my schedule of techs to set aside time for 61B projects... now worried I won't even manage to enroll. Is there a reason class size shrunk so much!? Is it possible the course will be expanded at all?
history.subject: 61B class size?
